bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Dr. and Francis C. Hall, June 30, 1942

div1.p: Hench sends Hall a reprint of his yellow fever article and thanks them for their contribution to the Camp Lazear Memorial Fund.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Dr. and Francis C. Hall, June 30, 1942
div1.opener:
June 30, 1942
Dr. Francis C. Hall
372 Marlborough St.
Boston, Massachusetts
My dear Francis:
div1.p:
Permit me to send you by separate post one
of my reprints which tells something of the yellow fever
story. Also permit me to thank you most kindly indeed
for the contribution of ten dollars for the memorial
fund. Incidentally, the name of the fund is the Camp
Lazear Memorial Fund and I think you can declare it on
your income tax statement.

I expect to enter military service in about
three weeks and after a preliminary period of training
land at Camp Carson, near Colorado Springs, for better or
for worse, probably the latter.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
